content.question: An object moves in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane a distance <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> at an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> measured counterclockwise from the positive <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-direction, where <math alttext="0 is less than theta, which is less than 90 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn><mo><</mo><mi>θ</mi><mo><</mo><msup><mn>90</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math>. The object then moves a distance <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> in the positive <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-direction. The change in the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of the object’s position is equal to the change in the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-component of its position. What is <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> in terms of <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> and <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="A times, open parenthesis, the sine of theta, minus the cosine of theta, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="A times, open parenthesis, the cosine of theta, minus the sine of theta, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>cos</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction A, over the tangent of theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>A</mi><mrow><mi>tan</mi><mi>θ</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>
